props.synopsis: South Australia's reservoirs are back to the low levels of the Millennium Drought era. But most of us aren't facing water restrictions this time around, largely because the state has something it didn't have back then – a desalination plant.

title.children: Without its desalination plant, SA would probably have water restrictions again

image.altText: Three abalone shells sitting on a hessian sack.

props.synopsis: Divers off the coast of Port MacDonnell made a grim discovery last February, finding a disease that has sent shockwaves through the abalone industry.

title.children: SA's abalone industry on high alert as 'devastating' disease spreads

image.altText: A politician in a suit with a white shirt walking into a building.

props.synopsis: When South Australian Liberal MP Tim Whetstone faced a challenge to his candidacy, the decision came down to just a few politically engaged party members in his electorate.

title.children: Dwindling membership leaves candidates' fate in hands of engaged few

props.synopsis: Organisers believe it was the biggest Marilyn Jetty Swim yet, with registrations for the iconic Cancer Council SA fundraiser being exhausted weeks in advance.

title.children: More than 700 Marilyn Monroes take the plunge in jetty swim

image.altText: A man and woman in a carriage, dressed in formal wear, pulled by a black horse team

props.synopsis: World champion carriage driver Boyd Exell returns home to Australia this year to help students learn the ropes of a sport with royal roots.

title.children: A carriage-driving master brings his skills back home

image.altText: A man stands with shark mitigation equipment, an airhorn and a first aid kit.

props.synopsis: Streaky Bay local Danny Lee, who is frustrated the community has been left to mitigate the risk of shark attacks on their coastline, is asking the government to increase funding to protect ocean users.

title.children: Community demands more shark mitigation funding after fatal SA attacks

image.altText: Paramedic wheels a trolley into an ambulance outside a health care facility.

props.synopsis: Health services warn of the dangers of heat-related illness on the vulnerable amid soaring temperatures across south-east Australia.

title.children: High-risk hot spell settles in for parts of Australia, sparking warnings

image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: A former senator says the documents are a sign the government is exploring the idea of dismantling nuclear submarines at shipyards in Adelaide's north-west, but the SA minister who attended the meeting says it was not the "focus" of the discussions.

title.children: Minister rejects claim talk about nuclear waste during UK trip signals plans for SA

image.altText: Two firefighters spray water across the grass of a brick home at night.

props.synopsis: A house has caught fire, reportedly after a lightning strike in Melbourne's north-west, as bushfires continue to burn in western Victoria.

title.children: Thousands without power as storms, heat and fires burn in Victoria

image.altText: A man wearing long sleeves, a broad brimmed hat and sunglasses stands on a pitch, light blue sky, trees in the background.

props.synopsis: Over a year on from several Australian organisations officially recognising participation in outdoor sport as a factor in the development of skin cancer, efforts to protect players in community sports remain "patchy".

title.children: Call for community sporting clubs to better protect members from skin cancer

image.altText: A man in handcuffs is escorted through a doorway by two policemen, with one holding him by the arm

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been sentenced for his involvement in a nightclub stabbing in Adelaide's CBD that left two people injured.

title.children: Victorian man sentenced for 'chaotic' Adelaide nightclub stabbing

image.altText: A house with red roof and red and cream brick with hard rubbish out the front

props.synopsis: Three youths accused of attempting to murder a man in Adelaide's north allegedly discussed their plans to make sure the target was dead in a group chat labelled "hit squad", a court has heard.

title.children: 'Hit squad': Six males face court over alleged botched murder attempt

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas and men from Santos stand on scaffolding at the Moomba CCS

props.synopsis: Santos says it's captured and stored 340,000 tonnes of CO2 and is on track to significantly expand operations — but an energy expert says in the scheme of Australia's 500 million tonnes of yearly emissions, it's more "PR exercise" than climate change solution.

title.children: As Santos celebrates carbon capture, expert says it's 'hardly a drop'

image.altText: Man standing in gardens

props.synopsis: A District Court Judge has asked for more evidence as to how much a by-election would cost before deciding whether to postpone Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell's sentencing on theft and dishonest dealing with documents offences.

title.children: By-election cost raised in Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell’s fraud case

image.altText: A large blue sign which says police in front of a large stone walkway.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Liberal Party is highlighting an increase in thefts and break-ins in the regional city ahead of a possible by-election to replace an MP found guilty of stealing.

title.children: Opposition hits out at surge in break-ins and theft in Mount Gambier

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The state and federal governments today announced they will dedicate a combined $30 million to the Whyalla airport, in addition to $3.14 million from the federal government to kick start the long-awaited foreshore development.

title.children: Major cash injection for Whyalla foreshore development and airport

image.altText: a photo of a CFA tanker parked with blaze on a hill in the background

props.synopsis: Residents living near bushfires at the Grampians National Park and Little Desert National Park have been warned to leave immediately while storms are forecast to hit Geelong and Melbourne's outer west.

title.children: Extreme weather in Victoria as bushfires and storms hit different parts of state

image.altText: The exterior of a building with corrugated metal sheets and a bright red logo, reading APY Art Centre Collective

props.synopsis: The final investigation into allegations of interference in First Nations artwork has concluded, with the Indigenous corporation regulator saying no further action will be taken.

title.children: Investigation into 'white hands on black art' allegations concludes

image.altText: Police car with officer and leafy street with houses in background.

props.synopsis: Police have responded to reports of a shooting incident in Adelaide's north-east.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after allegedly being shot in leg

image.altText: The back of millies head

props.synopsis: Selling your home is an occasion that would normally call for celebration, but for Millie, it's a day marked with feelings of betrayal, defeat and grief.

title.children: The legal loopholes permitting 'sexually transmitted tax debt'

image.altText: A man stands with his hands on his hips in front of piles of waste materials.

props.synopsis: Discarded batteries, ancient rubber tyres and drums of oil are the kinds of waste sitting on Australia's remote cattle stations that could have a brand new life if a researcher's plan comes to fruition.

title.children: The challenges of dealing with waste on remote cattle stations

image.altText: Peter Dutton, framed by a round window.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is clearly connecting with disenfranchised young men better than progressives and Anthony Albanese are. The risk is how that translates across the electorate.

title.children: Is Peter Dutton Australia's man whisperer?

image.altText: A drone shot of three-storey brick units on a sunny bright day.

props.synopsis: The ongoing pressure of high interest rates and the cost of living has pushed down house prices in some capital cities, opening up the market for first home buyers.

title.children: 'Buyers' market' opens up in some areas as house prices flatten

image.altText: A man carrying an Israeli flag stands in front of a house sprayed with antisemitic graffiti

props.synopsis: An extremism researcher says the protracted nature of the recent war has in part contributed to an "unprecedented" wave of antisemitic incidents in Australia.

title.children: Why Sydney is seeing so many antisemitic attacks of late

image.altText: deepseek written on a phone

props.synopsis: What no-one talks about as the AI revolution unfolds in stock market hype and scientific gung-ho is what the developers all really trying to do. They're trying to replicate the human brain.

title.children: 'None of us will have a job': How DeepSeek is changing the world

image.altText: Plastic water bottles sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: The tests show there is no need for concern in most parts of the state, but concerning levels of the "forever chemicals" have been detected in three regions.

title.children: PFAS testing blitz returns worrying results for some NSW communities

image.altText: Celeste Barber stands with arms folded leaning against a graffiti wall. She wears a red and black short sleeve dress

props.synopsis: Celeste Barber has found global fame for her Instagram parodies of A-listers. But behind the laughs is a story about the dark side of ADHD.

title.children: Celeste Barber has always felt like her brain 'betrayed' her

image.altText: Firefighting foam fills a large crater next to a Macy's sign

props.synopsis: Philadelphia Mayor Cherelle Parker says a person who was in a car at the time of the crash has died, along with six people on the plane.

title.children: Person in car killed when plane crashed on Philadelphia road

image.altText: Emergency personnel work near the site of the crash, with the US Capitol in the background.

props.synopsis: Preliminary data about the aircraft collision over Washington DC shows conflicting readings about the altitudes of the passenger plane and army helicopter.

title.children: Washington DC crash preliminary data raises questions about aircrafts' altitude

image.altText: two carton eggs

props.synopsis: NSW Police are searching for three men who were allegedly in a car believed to be involved in an antisemitic attack on a group of young women in Sydney's east on Saturday night.

title.children: Five women targeted in potential antisemitic attack at Bondi Beach

image.altText: A bald man wearing glasses and Adidas jacket sits in a car with a woman in Muslim head dress

props.synopsis: There are emotional scenes in the Middle East as three Israeli hostages and 183 Palestinian prisoners and detainees are released, as the ceasefire in Gaza reaches the end of its second week.

title.children: Ceasefire brings bittersweet reunions in Israel, the West Bank and Gaza

image.altText: Mauro Schmid points back behind him

props.synopsis: Temperatures reached 41 degrees as Swiss national champion Mauro Schmid won his first UCI World Tour one day race in blistering conditions in Geelong.

title.children: Swiss rider delivers long-awaited win as peloton boils in 40+ degree temperatures

image.altText: NSW Transport Minister Jo Haylen stands behind a number of microphones at a press conference at central rail station

props.synopsis: NSW transport minister Jo Haylen tasked a taxpayer-funded ministerial driver to transport her and her friends on a day out in the Hunter Valley on Australia Day.

title.children: NSW minister admits use of ministerial car for 'long lunch' inappropriate

image.altText: Chief Justice Andrew Bell in a suit

props.synopsis: With artificial intelligence set to be restricted in New South Wales' legal system from Monday, the state's Chief Justice has flagged his concerns over the technology.

title.children: AI restrictions within NSW’s legal system take effect from Monday

image.altText: A pair of hands holding two different pineapples of a different size and shape, other pineapples are visible below

props.synopsis: Growers fear the time it takes to cut up a pineapple and clean the mess off the chopping board is behind flatlining sales.

title.children: Time-poor Aussies leave 'inconvenient' fruits off the shopping list
